market_summary: US equities were mixed over the past 72 hours, with the S&P 500 consolidating near all-time highs amid ongoing Q4 earnings season.
CPI data released yesterday showed core inflation slightly above expectations (MoM +0.3% vs. +0.2% est.), causing a brief spike in yields and rotation out of rate-sensitive sectors.
Several large-cap tech names reported strong earnings, while industrials lagged on softer forward guidance.

thesis_damage_flags.why: 3M (MMM) issued disappointing Q1 guidance and announced further legal reserves related to ongoing litigation, raising concerns about forward earnings quality and capital allocation.

thesis: Lam Research (LRCX) reported strong Q4 results, beating both revenue and EPS estimates, and raised FY guidance on robust semiconductor equipment demand.
Momentum remains positive, with the stock outperforming the S&P 500 over 1, 3, and 6 months, supported by AI-driven capex cycles at major foundries.
Balance sheet quality is high, with net cash position and consistent capital returns via buybacks and dividends.
risks: Semiconductor equipment orders are cyclical and could slow if macro conditions deteriorate or if foundry capex is delayed.
Geopolitical tensions (e.g., US-China export controls) could impact LRCX's addressable market.
Valuation is above historical averages, increasing downside risk if growth expectations are not met.
falsifiable_checks: If LRCX's next quarterly report shows order growth below 5% YoY, thesis should be re-examined.
If major foundry customers (TSMC, Samsung, Intel) announce capex cuts of >10% in the next 6 months, thesis is at risk.
trade_of_the_day.why_now: LRCX is benefiting from a multi-year AI and memory upgrade cycle, with strong near-term momentum and quality metrics. Recent earnings and guidance upgrades provide visibility for the next 6-18 months, while sector rotation into semis continues post-CPI.
